info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 02 at 5:38AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR MINOR FLOODING TODAY INTO TONIGHT FROM WIDESPREAD RAIN COMBINED WITH HEAVIER SHOWERS FROM THUNDERSTORMS... A slow moving disturbance will combine with deep moisture to bring widespread rain and rain showers to much of North Central, Central, and Southwest Montana today into tonight. The widespread rain will help saturate the ground somewhat, and scattered embedded thunderstorms will likely cause brief periods of heavier rainfall. As a result, the Weather Prediction Center indicates that there is at least a 15 percent chance that there will be enough rainfall to cause rapid onset flooding for much of the area. The main area of concern is along east of a Havre to Great Falls to Bozeman line, where there is at least a 60 percent chance for at least 0.50 inches of rainfall, and at least a 40 percent chance of at least 1.00 inches. Localized heavy rainfall with thunderstorms today into tonight could cause some minor flooding impacts. This includes the potential for minor flooding of streets, as well as standing water on rural roads, in fields, and in areas with poor drainage. Rivers, creeks, and streams will also see higher flows through the weekend, and some smaller creeks and streams may flow out of their banks for brief periods. If you will be participating in outdoor activities this weekend, keep an eye out for river rises, potential flooding, and debris flows out of mountains, and have a plan to seek shelter or higher ground.
